column1: Drainage covers in 6-foot on Slabtrack have deteriorated~and broken in sections resulting in a fall hazard. What could have happened: Injury to staff trough slip, trip, fall into exposed drainage run. Addition risk posed by exposed metal edges where grill has broken.~Actions Taken: Unable to fix on site. Drainage covers require replacement.

https://what3words.com/flattered.static.passes Installation of new pedestrian access point at west end of Inverness Airport Station Platform 1. Carriage key required to unlock access point gates. Cables lying on ground at bottom of steps
WARNING SSOW WORKING PROHIBITED WITHIN LIMITS OF NEW INVERNESS AIRPORT STATION.
Authorised Access Point - Road Rail Machines Culloden Sidings - Old Station Yard

THE SUITABILITY OF THE EDGE PROTECTION ON THIS STRUCTURE CANNOT BE RELIED UPON TO PREVENT A FALL FROM HEIGHT. UNASSISTED WARNING SSOW WORKING IS PROHIBITED, ATWS/LOWS MAY BE USED ONLY IF THE STRUCTURE IS LESS THAN 30 METRES LONG AND A MINIMUM 25 SECOND WARNING TIME IS BEING USED. ONLY ACTIVITIES THAT CAN BE CARRIED OUT WHILST REMAINING WITHIN THE 4 FOOT ARE ALLOWED TO BE UNDERTAKEN ON THIS STRUCTURE, UNLESS SUITABLE CONTROL MEASURES TO PREVENT FALLS FROM HEIGHT ARE APPROVED AND RECORDED BY AN ENGINEER AND IMPLEMENTED ON SITE.

Access via Longannet Power Station main entrance and along main power station roadway to gate in perimeter fence leading to dust pipe roadway, thence pathway to signalbox, crossing the running line. Signalbox is located on right hand side

1000 yards from Newbridge roundabout on the Newbridge/Wilkieston side on UB14 . Gate entrance to relay room on left hand side. Continue on pathway through gate for 300 yards. Reaching top of incline turn to the left. Proceed along pathway which runs parallel to Bathgate lines for 300 yards. Relay room directly ahead, main door entrance facing Glasgow main lines.

From Winchburgh Village, turn off B9080 at village school onto B8020. Proceed for half mile up to UB1. Gate on left hand side for entrance to railway. Proceed to next gate , then proceed for half mile along path beside Dalmeny/Winchburgh branch line towards Winchburgh Junction. Relay room building straight ahead between Glasgow main line and Dalmeny branch line.
Exclusion zone set up around raw sewage which is seeping through the cess area

From A70 ring road north, turn into Ayr station car park. Walk through ~ entrance on to platform 4. Turn left and walk down ramp to entrance to Apparatus Hut, keeping on path.~ Node=SW023A

From the A79, turn into Woodfield Road. Cross over Oswald Road into Bellrock Road and over OB43. Turn left, and a cess gate is on the left hand side at the next bend. The Apparatus Hut is via the gate, then 20 yards on the left.~ Node=SW021B
From the new road at Tam s Brig, turn into McCalls Avenue, then right into the approach road, through the gate into the vehicle park, thence along the front of the building to entrance.~ Node=SW023A

On the A737 from Dalry, after passing under the railway bridge, turn left at road signposted ~Kersland Farm~. Continue on this road for approximately 0.5 miles, turn left through farm gate before bungalow on right at top of hill. Follow dirt to the rail

The UTX cross the track perpendicular to track centreline. All ducts to be 150mm Internal diameter fireclay duct, or approved red plastic duct 12-24>. Duct seals to be included in accordance with with NR/SP/CIV/044.*UTX to comprise of 2 x 150 I.D. and 1 x 50 I.D. ducts with concrete surround and 1 x BT Cables >. Ducts installed at a minimum depth of 900mm below underside of sleeper level, and a minimum depth of 750mm below existing road carageway level, to top of duct surround. This may be increased if necessary to avoid track drainage,

THE SUITABILITY OF THE EDGE PROTECTION ON THIS STRUCTURE CANNOT BE RELIED UPON TO PREVENT A FALL FROM HEIGHT. UNASSISTED WARNING SSOW WORKING IS PROHIBITED, ATWS/LOWS MAY BE USED ONLY IF THE STRUCTURE IS LESS THAN 30 METRES LONG AND A MINIMUM 25 SECOND WARNING TIME IS BEING USED. ONLY ACTIVITIES THAT CAN BE CARRIED OUT WHILST REMAINING WITHIN THE 4 FOOT ARE ALLOWED TO BE UNDERTAKEN ON THIS STRUCTURE, UNLESS SUITABLE CONTROL MEASURES TO PREVENT FALLS FROM HEIGHT ARE APPROVED AND RECORDED BY AN ENGINEER AND IMPLEMENTED ON SITE.

The padlock that has been put onto the up side vehicular gate, is a Network Rail padlock, code number PS1, and is not to be removed or replaced.To gain access at this location, staff require a PS1 key, or they can not use this access point. The reason for this change is to rectify a number of issues that have been reported by the authorised user at this location, including trespass, vandalism and poaching.

Records of the water supply pipeline layouts although limited are indicative of the main runs and are held by Senior Asset Manager and the Facility Delivery Manager. The main water supply valves are located in Hope Street basement and the main feeder tanks with separate meter supply for the train watering system, are located in the Broomielaw arches.

Records of the gas supply pipeline layouts are indicative of the main runs and are held by the Senior Asset Manager and the Facility Delivery Manager. The main supply enters the station via the Red Star archway on Hope Street and is piped to the boiler room in archway 4E. There is also a gas supply off Union Street Ramp. All mains gas supply pipes up to and including the meter are the responsibility of National Grid. In case of emergency contact 0800 111 999. Natural gas is non-toxic, but large concentrations could cause suffocation. It is highly flammable and leakage from a pipeline could result in an explosive mixture with air. Noise of escaping gas could be sufficient to cause damage to hearing and ear protection must be worn. All persons must be kept 100 metres from the damaged pipeline.

THE SUITABILITY OF THE EDGE PROTECTION ON THIS STRUCTURE CANNOT BE RELIED UPON TO PREVENT A FALL FROM HEIGHT. UNASSISTED WARNING SSOW WORKING IS PROHIBITED, ATWS/LOWS MAY BE USED ONLY IF THE STRUCTURE IS LESS THAN 30 METRES LONG AND A MINIMUM 25 SECOND WARNING TIME IS BEING USED. ONLY ACTIVITIES THAT CAN BE CARRIED OUT WHILST REMAINING WITHIN THE 4 FOOT ARE ALLOWED TO BE UNDERTAKEN ON THIS STRUCTURE, UNLESS SUITABLE CONTROL MEASURES TO PREVENT FALLS FROM HEIGHT ARE APPROVED AND RECORDED BY AN ENGINEER AND IMPLEMENTED ON SITE.

Requirement to disturb the surface within the station's controlled area, the Buried Services Procedure shall be followed at all times. Work will not be allowed to commence until such time that a Permit to Dig/Penetrate form has been duly signed by the Contract Administrator. Numerous low voltage cables are located underground throughout the station. Each contractor will be responsible for the scanning of the work site in order to locate the exact location of the underground power cables.

Category 4 - Severe Wire Degradation. Fragile wiring within Relay Room. Disturbance and hand tracing of wires is prohibited. Planned work must be notified to S&TME Glasgow 48hrs in advance of the works taking place. Office hours must be notified to Infrastructure Control on 0141 335 2002.

Following on from the recent various RRV derailments on the Tulloch sidings Scotland Route are restricting the use until further notice of lighter weight RRVs such as Landrovers, Rail Rangers, Nissan Navarro’s, which are all under 3.5tonne from on/off tracking in the sidings.This restriction does not apply top larger heavier weight RRVs such as Iveco’s, Canters and Unimogs etc or 360 degree excavators and trailers, also the sleeper suite RMMMs including the Brad mini tamper, MRT sleeper changers and the Robel Mini tamper.OTM tampers or stone blowers are not affected by this restriction on using the sidingsAny issues or further clarification please contact DL-RSCOPlant@networkrail.co.uk

Before setting up a safe system of work within the confines of Alstom Yard the PICOS shall meet with the Production Manager from Alstom . Full discussion and agreement shall be reached following Alstom Yard protocols including Depot Protection Arrangements Staff cannot go on or near the line in Alstom Yard area until full agreement has been reached with the Production Manager and PICOS and all safety protocols have been put in place for staff to remain safe from the passage of trains.Please contact Glasgow WHSEA from Network Rail for more assistance and details on the confines of Alstom Yard.

A Scottish Water 600mm diameter is burried parrallel behind a Network Rail boundary wall appx. 0.6m to 1m below surface level.At the location between 114.0890 - 114.1000 the pipe is appx 3m behind the boundary wall and beyond this milage the pipe diverges away from the railway and wall .The land owner is the Convent of the Good Shepard. They reguarlly have Network Rail access through their property for examinations etc. This is a Hazard as loading the pipe with plant would require a design and notification to SW. This limits potential works to the boundary wall.

The highways and legal departments have confirmed that Gartocher Terrace is a private road however it must be noted residents of Gartocher Terrace are not exclusive owners of this road and the access is not restricted. Staff should avoid parking on the road if possible and use the yard to avoid any future conflict with the residents. Staff should avoid any confrontation with the public, call the The Police and remove themselves from the area if harrased. Glasgow MDU Workforce Health and Safety Advisor and Community Relations can provide more detail.

From Main Street Lockerbie, turn Bridge Street then turn right into Park Place. Follow road to right at play area and continue along tarmac road to lock-up garages at rear of houses, and access lineside via metal gate. Walk south along the up cess to th

From Main Street turn into Station Road and follow to the station. Access down platform and cross to up platform via footbridge, then walk north to platform ramp. Cross up loop and walk north via up cess to Ground Frame.~ Node=C001

From the A74 southbound, pass and after 5 miles turn left at sign for Newton and Wamphray. Follow road to crossroads and turn left; follow road for 200 yards then take first right to UB159. Turn right immediately after bridge and follow the road towards
From the A74 heading south, take the turn off for Beattock. and continue to Beattock village. Take right turn to old station and into car parking area where the Relay Room is located.~ Node=C001
On A74 South, pass Beattock; after = mile take first left to OB 258. Access to lineside and GF via gate and path.~ Node=C001

From the A8 travelling east, take the A725 to Whifflet. At Whifflet traffic lights, continue 150 yards to the roundabout. Turn left into Dundyvan Road. The access road to the Relay Room is via the gate which is just off the roundabout on the right hand side. Once through the gate, continue to the single gate, and the Relay Room is just beyond.

From the A74 southbound, take the exit for Eaglesfield and turn left at the top of the slip road to OB61 Access is via a gate to stairs leading down to the up cess. Walk south along the up cess to the Ground Frame, taking care in areas affected by points

THE SUITABILITY OF THE EDGE PROTECTION ON THIS STRUCTURE CANNOT BE RELIED UPON TO PREVENT A FALL FROM HEIGHT. UNASSISTED WARNING SSOW WORKING IS PROHIBITED, ATWS/LOWS MAY BE USED ONLY IF THE STRUCTURE IS LESS THAN 30 METRES LONG AND A MINIMUM 25 SECOND WARNING TIME IS BEING USED. ONLY ACTIVITIES THAT CAN BE CARRIED OUT WHILST REMAINING WITHIN THE 4 FOOT ARE ALLOWED TO BE UNDERTAKEN ON THIS STRUCTURE, UNLESS SUITABLE CONTROL MEASURES TO PREVENT FALLS FROM HEIGHT ARE APPROVED AND RECORDED BY AN ENGINEER AND IMPLEMENTED ON SITE.

The UTX cross the track perpendicular to track centreline. All ducts to be 150mm Internal diameter fireclay duct, or approved red plastic duct 12-24>. Duct seals to be included in accordance with with NR/SP/CIV/044.*UTX to comprise of 2 x 150 I.D. and 1 x 50 I.D. ducts with concrete surround and 1 x BT Cables >. Ducts installed at a minimum depth of 900mm below underside of sleeper level, and a minimum depth of 750mm below existing road carageway level, to top of duct surround. This may be increased if necessary to avoid track drainage,

Construction works associated with the rock break out and removal through Arkleston cut as part of the ongoing works on the Paisley Corridor Improvements Project. In connection with these Works ALL personnel / Contractors are to be aware of these Construction Works which will provide new hazards to the Operational Line. Construction Activities which will affect this are:~ ~ i>Installation of vertical concrete barriers along both the up and down cess. The barriers are required to protect the existing infrastructure whilst re-profiling the existing embankments. This will result in limited access to any existing cable trough routes and Loc cabinets. In addition any current positions of safety within the cess will no longer be available.~ ii>The barriers are programmed to be in place from week 36 to 48 2010/11.

Existing masonry arch structure has been fully removed to ground leve as part of the EGIP route clearance works. A new steel footbridge OB132/073A has been installed adjacent at mileage 101m 335y. The new footbridge currently carries a single street lighting cable feeding a lighting column at the north abutment. No other utilities cross in this bridge, although there are 3 no unused ducts for future provision.

An ecological assessment was carried out in November 2002 as past of the Kennishead Project. Assessment showed the presence of otters and the potential presence ofwatervole in the area.An Otter holt was constructed during the embankment project. The river area is designated Corridor of Wildlife and Landscape Importance
Disturbance during the bird breeding season should be avoided. 2004
Survey carried out of the canal area has identified both a water vole and water shrew population

ONLY ACTIVITIES THAT CAN BE CARRIED OUT WHILST REMAINING WITHIN THE 4 FOOT ARE ALLOWED TO BE UNDERTAKEN ON THIS STRUCTURE, UNLESS SUITABLE CONTROL MEASURES TO PREVENT FALLS FROM HEIGHT ARE APPROVED AND RECORDED BY AN ENGINEER AND IMPLEMENTED ON SITE.

From Edinburgh city centre to the Calton Road, continue into Abbeyhill Road and turn right into Croft-an-righ. Double access gate immediately after UB03 on the left hand side. Apparatus Hut is through gate and up access stairs.

Travelling on the A1 road from Edinburgh town centre, turn left into Duddingston Road, turn right into Mountcastle Drive North, and then right into Mountcastle Crescent. Turn right into depot access road , then left into car park. Access to the Apparatus Hut is across the tracks via sleeper crossing and concrete crossing at depot entrance, then turn left and walk along cess via chipped walkway to door.
Cardenden: Station platform.
Masterton Viaduct Road traffic
Jennie Rennie s footpath - Road traffic noise - down side
Node=E020
Aviemore signalbox - OB205
Turn off Coylumbridge Road and follow Dalfaber Road Northwards for 1/4 mile to access gate, thence to lineside
Through public car park and along the roadway at the rear of the Police Station to the signalbox steps. Relay Room at rear.
Turn West off B9153 at Carr Bridge village and follow Station Road for 1/2 mile, then turn South onto station approach. Thence along lineside from station

From A9 at Slochd Summit, turn left through wooden gate, then right onto former A9 road. The lineside access gate is located a further 100 yards along this roadway on the left hand side. Access to the Relay Room is across both Up and Down lines
Turn West off A9 and follow old A9 for 1 mile. Turn right before viaduct and follow old station road for 300 yards to gate. Thence along lineside from South access gate

From A9 at Tomatin, turn left at "Little Chef"restaurant onto alignment of old A9 road. Continue for approximately 600 yards past entrance to ~Tomatin Distillers~ and turn right onto poorly surfaced track which leads to site of former station and former Relay Room. Relay Room is accessed via gate, and by crossing both Up and Down lines. A telephone is provided for asking the signalman for permission to cross due to limited sighting

Turn off Russel Road into Sauchiebank Cul-de-sac. Proceed straight ahead for 80 yards, turn to the left at the top. Proceed through main security gate, veering to the left. S&T workshop building on the left, main relay room door facing running lines.

3 miles east of Dunbar, on the A1 road, an unclassified road to the left signposted "Cement Works". Proceed for 1/2 mile towards cement works, reaching a point where the road veers to the left., stopping at the turning point. A gate immediately to the right is the access to the relay room. The relay room doors face the main lines.

Grantshouse to Innerwick: Bi-directional working on both lines.

At Burnmouth, on main road , turn left onto the road to Eyemouth and continue as far as the road to Burnmouth Harbour on the right. Access gate is directly opposite Burnmouth Primary School. Parking at school, access to Apparatus Hut is via gate and down stairs, thence by slabbed walkway.
Edinburgh Waverley Station : all through lines to be considered Bi-directional.
From Edinburgh Waverley station car park, walk over footbridge to platform 21. Apparatus Hut is located on west ramp.
"From Edinburgh Waverley station car park, walk through gate to end of platform 7 Apparatus Hut is located down ramp and alongside Platform 5/6. Node=E00
Craigentinny: East Depot Line - Bi- directional.

Proceeding from Musselburgh to Millerhill on the B6415 road, turn off to the left 20 yards beyond the main entrance to Monktonhall golf club . On entering road end, veer immediately to the right, walking directly ahead for 90 yards. Monktonhall relay room main entrance with door facing running lines.
Prestonpans Bi-directional over down line.
Access to relay room from gate off B1377 road. Walking directly along pathway for 50 yards leads to doorway of relay room which faces North Berwick line and East Coast main lines.

On the A1 between East Linton and Dunbar, 0.25 miles past the junction with the A198 , park in layby on left hand side of road. Apparatus Hut is on opposite side of road, and is accessed via fence and steps.
Dunbar Passenger Loop: Bi-directional.
Kingsknowe AHB to Slateford Station: Bi-directional over down line only.

An area next to REIDVALE BRIDGE just by 38 WHITEVALE GARDENS where one of the fence slats has been removed allowing access to a wooded area. The area is directly next to the railway and has ladders propped next to a fence at the far side which allows access to an unused footpath and the railway tracks. Would we be able to extend the metal fencing which is already in place behind the wooden council installed fence.

Please ensure notification letters are issued to surrounding properties and to travellers sites on Strathclyde Street and Swanston Street prior to any noisy works. This area has received a lot of complaints in the past from noise from generators, plant and machinery and staff shouting. Please also be aware of hostile neighbours at Swanston Street, there is a risk of bricks and objects being thrown from above, to staff on site. Please ensure that when carrying work out in this location you contact British Transport Police in advance on the works at: D-RailProjects@btp.pnn.police.uk

Further to recent incidents of rock-fall within the locale of the PSG access via Kings Stables Road we must insist on the following procedures being adopted when using this authorised access point:~~• All Network Rail and Edinburgh City Council gates MUST be locked behind you on entry/exit~• Only once the possession/blockage is granted should all staff/equipment be taken to site; then the vehicle MUST be parked away from the PSG access point~~Historic Scotland have gracefully requested us to observe the above instructions to ensure that no damage is sustained to this conservation area, particularly the SSSI site at Princes St Gardens or the “listed” St Margaret’s Well at this World Heritage Site. ~This is a critical access point for NR and our contractors, so please adhere to the above guidance.
Osprey nest on Pylon - repeated breeders - noisy works buffer required between April 1st and August 31st.
Nesting black-throated divers on the loch edge between March 1st and 31st August - noisy works buffer required
Water vole burrows in wet ditch between railway boundary and forest at 14.0540 - protected species licence may be needed for some works.
Main Badger Sett on third party land c. 20m from the up line. Noisy works or works causing vibration will require a licence and input from an ecologist.
Outlier Badger Sett x. 10m from the boundary measure on the up line
Red squirrel drey confirmed on lineside conifer. 50m buffer required between 1st February and 30th September inclusive. 5m buffer for the rest of the year.
Three outlier Badger Setts on the lineside embankment between 113.1540 and 113.1640 miles.
In the region of 80 entrances forming a massive main Badger Sett, annexe and outliers, chiefly on the Up but a few on the Down.

Following on from the recent various RRV derailments on the Tulloch sidings Scotland Route are restricting the use until further notice of lighter weight RRVs such as Landrovers, Rail Rangers, Nissan Navarro’s, which are all under 3.5tonne from on/off tracking in the sidings.This restriction does not apply top larger heavier weight RRVs such as Iveco’s, Canters and Unimogs etc or 360 degree excavators and trailers, also the sleeper suite RMMMs including the Brad mini tamper, MRT sleeper changers and the Robel Mini tamper.OTM tampers or stone blowers are not affected by this restriction on using the sidingsAny issues or further clarification please contact DL-RSCOPlant@networkrail.co.uk

All 650v cabling to be treated as being at a dangerous potential, even if disconnected from its usual source; any work on this cabling or associated terminations shall be undertaken in accordance with NR/L3/SIGELP/50003 – Safe Working Procedures when Working On or Near Signalling Equipment Section 9.6. "Hot” Working

Between Cadder and Bo"ness Interlocking area there are 6 x 650v feeders which are condisered at risk due to the length of the feeders. Cadder Fedder 2, Gartshore Feeder 1 & 2, Greenhill Feeder 2 and Polmont Feeder 1 & 2. Telecoms test circuits - Cadder RR, Gartshore RR , Greenhill SB AR , Greenhill Core Node , Falkirk High AN , Falkirk High AN , Polmont AN . Until renewal of these feeders and removal of the telecomms test circuits, "Hot working is introduced in accordance with NR/L3/SIGELP/50003 - Safe Working procedures when working on or near signalling equipment Section 9.6, when working on these cables.

A total of seventeen Miramare bat boxes installed on trees, D line. Nine bat boxes installed on trees within the lineside between 14.0795 and 14.1431, with eight boxes on 3PL trees adjacent to the railway boundary between 14.1494 and 15.0219. All boxes are located at a similar distance from the running rail. If confirmed as occupied by bats, works within 30m may require a licence. Consult NwR ecologist.

Multiple sign-posted habitat piles for biodiversity enhancement within the lineside and on 3PL, at a safe distance from the running rail. Might contain nesting birds, reptiles, amphibians, hedgehogs, other small mammals. If removal or works on the habitat piles are required, consult NwR ecologist.

THE SUITABILITY OF THE EDGE PROTECTION ON THIS STRUCTURE CANNOT BE RELIED UPON TO PREVENT A FALL FROM HEIGHT. UNASSISTED WARNING SSOW WORKING IS PROHIBITED, ATWS/LOWS MAY BE USED ONLY IF THE STRUCTURE IS LESS THAN 30 METRES LONG AND A MINIMUM 25 SECOND WARNING TIME IS BEING USED. ONLY ACTIVITIES THAT CAN BE CARRIED OUT WHILST REMAINING WITHIN THE 4 FOOT ARE ALLOWED TO BE UNDERTAKEN ON THIS STRUCTURE, UNLESS SUITABLE CONTROL MEASURES TO PREVENT FALLS FROM HEIGHT ARE APPROVED AND RECORDED BY AN ENGINEER AND IMPLEMENTED ON SITE.

THE SUITABILITY OF THE EDGE PROTECTION ON THIS STRUCTURE CANNOT BE RELIED UPON TO PREVENT A FALL FROM HEIGHT. UNASSISTED WARNING SSOW WORKING IS PROHIBITED, ATWS/LOWS MAY BE USED ONLY IF THE STRUCTURE IS LESS THAN 30 METRES LONG AND A MINIMUM 25 SECOND WARNING TIME IS BEING USED. ONLY ACTIVITIES THAT CAN BE CARRIED OUT WHILST REMAINING WITHIN THE 4 FOOT ARE ALLOWED TO BE UNDERTAKEN ON THIS STRUCTURE, UNLESS SUITABLE CONTROL MEASURES TO PREVENT FALLS FROM HEIGHT ARE APPROVED AND RECORDED BY AN ENGINEER AND IMPLEMENTED ON SITE.

Exclusion Zone for human exposure:1.5m in front of the antenna, 1m either side of 0.25m behind the antenna. This zone only applies if a human is within 0.5m vertically of the antenna. Do not remain within this zone. It is possible to safely pass through this zone. Exclusion zone for lineside electronic equipment: No electronic equipment to be installed closer than 16m in front and 1.5m behing the antenna. This only applies if the equipment is within 5.5m vertically of the antenna,

Item 1 - 95mm power cable to be laid on top of the existing euro grid access walkway from land span 4 based on the Wormit side of the bridge to river span 16. The cable will be connected to a 200KVA generator. The power cable will be located between the propsed air duct and the handrail / wind fence to allow adequate access to the existing walkway. Item 2 - A 150mm aluminium air duct that will be fixed to the existing eurogrid walkway will carry compressed air from a compressor based on the land spans on the Wormit side of the bridge to river span 24 with capacity up to 12 bar of pressure.

Various underground cables and troughing associated with feeder station.

Lower Arches /Arches Theatre - Pump room. Towards the back of the furthest arch ‘Devils Arch’ within Arches Theatre is the Pump Room. The room giving access to the pump Room has an uneven floor with piles of sand and gravel and the lighting does not function. The Pump Room itself is well lit but includes many hazards. There are two deep shafts, one with a winch and apparatus and the other is an access to the lower pump area. This is fitted with a ladder and is undoubtedly a confined space. Another main hazard is the sump area which receives and redirects the water. These areas are fitted with barriers. There are two floor levels, floor slabs which are believed to cover cables, further electric cables and a switchboard. Waste materials and other materials, which may not be waste, litter the area. The hazards are electrical, slips, trips, falls, drowning and others associated with confined spaces.

Basement - Main central corridor. This area of the arches has been partly upgraded with the installation of new lighting and heating and ventilation piping. The main electricity cables have also been labelled identifying them. Along the central area of the corridor runs metal covers which give access to a channel which houses high voltage cables. There are a number of locations within the corridor where cables run from the walls towards this channel. Areas within this channel will be considered as a confined space / limited access if working under the metal covers.

From Fort William on the A830 travel to Arisaig, take 2nd turning on right, and follow the road signposted ~Station Car Park~. At station, enter gate to platform. Apparatus Hut is in old station building.

Proceed via factory access road and along the up main line to the signalbox location, thence by sleeper crossing to signalbox. Total warning time required 10 seconds. Minimum sighting distance available 13 seconds. ENSURE LINE IS CLEAR BEFORE ATTEMPTING TO CROSS
Via gate in Muirhall Road wall adjacent to signalbox
From Cowie Road on the down line side to the signalbox via path at side of old station house
Node=W059B~ 04/07/2008 This could be removed, providing the Engineers token is taken as per the first requirement. This Section could be walked through alone.

From Loch Awe village on the A85, Apparatus Hut is located 1 mile past the Hydro Electric Visitors Centre on the right hand side of the road. Car parking is possible behind the bollards. Walk 10 yards to compound and through gate to Apparatus Hut
Gate behind garages in Kerse Lane~ Node=W018~ Mileage changed by Keith Brown after trackwalk 1/3/02
From Strawfrank Road Carstairs, turn in to the Depot on the down side of OB405, and pass through yard and along dirt track leading to the Ground Frame.~ Node=C002

Travelling east from Lanark on the A70, turn right at Carstairs village into Carstairs Road. Continue on into Station Road and thence to Strawfrank Road. Pass the station entrance and turn left through the yard access. The Relay Room is opposite.~ Node=C0

From Lanark on the A706 heading towards Forth, Apparatus Hut is on the righthand side just before Cleghorn Level Crossing, approximately 2 miles from Lanark. Access is via gate at level crossing. Parking in layby just before level crossing.~ Node=C005

On the A73 between Newmains and Carluke, turn right at Bogside into Wildman Road . Continue for approximately 0.5 miles. The Relay Room is accessed via the Field gate on the left hand side, just before the railway bridge.~ Node=C005
On the A74 heading south, take the slip road to the vehicle park at Beattock Summit. Access to the Relay Room is from the car park; turn left and through the wooden gate.~ Node=C001

From M74 exit at junction 13 Abington, follow A702 through village to South end, then turn left into Old Station Road. Follow road to Relay Room compound and access gate to down cess Walk south. along the down cess to OB306, then cross track to up cess a

From the A74 heading south, take the turn off for Abingtoninto Carlisle Road. Take turning on left into Station Road as far as bend in road. The Relay Room is on the left hand side, adjacent to the loop.~ Node=C001
Enter by main gate and cross bridge, along up platform, thence along sidings cess
From main entrance through goods yard between down sidings, cross down siding and down and up lines opposite signal box
From station via Aberdeen Road, main Aberdeen/Inverness Road towards Inverness, thence Bahill Road, through wicket gate and crossing to signalbox
From the rear of Keith Depot Car Park, use the gravel walking route to the crossing on the main line to the GRP access route which leads directly to Keith Signal Box.

Between Bellgrove Jct and Sighthill Jct: excessive voltages may be induced in Telecomms circuits. For work on any such circuit, liaise with Railtrack Production Control or arrange isolation of PS1 & PS2. Examples of ~work~ in this context = work on lineside and signal phones; disconnecting and terminating tail cables and jumper wires at lineside cross-connection cabinets and distribution frames; installation of new telecomms circuits requiring running of cables and testing; repairing cable damage. A First Engineering Work Instruction applies.

Chromium contamination throughout this area. This area is known for being affected by chromium contamination arising from waste from the former Shawfield Chemical Works which was located close to this area. Site workers must be briefed on the presence of, and risks posed by, Chromium as part of the site induction before entering the area. Specific occupational risk management including specific PPE and Health Surveillance must be considered and in place before any tasks are undertaken in this are. Please contact your local Health and Safety Advisor and Environment Manager for further information and specific Work Activity Risk Assessment content.

Pantograph Monitoring System cameras have been installed at Hyndland Station on the footbridge and will be working from 26th October 2019. The camera is located on the footbridge and contains lasers to be able to scan the pantograph. The cameras contains 2 types of lasers: ~LDS30 Laser Ranger ~- The laser rangers are used for distance measurements and for identifying when a train/pantograph is under the scanner. ~- The laser rangers are Laser Class 1 and herefore considered eye safe under all conditions. ~ZQ1 Line Laser ~- The line laser emits a laser line with an angel of 60 degrees.~- The line laser is not to be considered eye safe at the emitting point of the laser. However since the laser spreads its energy in an angle, the intensity per area decreases with the distance. ~It has been agreed that when work is taking place using machines underneath the cameras the cameras should be turned off. This can be done using the isolation switch on structure number B 03 42

THE SUITABILITY OF THE EDGE PROTECTION ON THIS STRUCTURE CANNOT BE RELIED UPON TO PREVENT A FALL FROM HEIGHT. UNASSISTED WARNING SSOW WORKING IS PROHIBITED, ATWS/LOWS MAY BE USED ONLY IF THE STRUCTURE IS LESS THAN 30 METRES LONG AND A MINIMUM 25 SECOND WARNING TIME IS BEING USED. ONLY ACTIVITIES THAT CAN BE CARRIED OUT WHILST REMAINING WITHIN THE 4 FOOT ARE ALLOWED TO BE UNDERTAKEN ON THIS STRUCTURE, UNLESS SUITABLE CONTROL MEASURES TO PREVENT FALLS FROM HEIGHT ARE APPROVED AND RECORDED BY AN ENGINEER AND IMPLEMENTED ON SITE.

SCOTLAND ROUTE HAS INTRODUCED A PROHIBITION ON THE USE OF WARNING SSOW WORKING UNLESS PROTECTION IS PROVIDED BY LOWS OR TOWS. THIS INCLUDES WORKING AS AN INDIVIDUAL WORKING ALONE OR GOING DOWN THE HIERARCHY WHEN PROTECTION SSOW IS OR BECOMES UNAVAILABLE. YOU WILL STILL BE ALLOWED TO "CROSS THE LINE" OR GO ROUND AN OBSTACLE AS LONG AS YOUR PRIMARY SSOW IS A PROTECTION SSOW AND YOU HAVE SIGHTING DISTANCE AND HAVE A WAY OF CALCULATING THIS DISTANCE. DO NOT ACCEPT ANY PLAN THAT HAS WARNING SSOW AS THE PRIMARY SSOW UNLESS LOWS OR TOWS ARE UTILISED.

Please adhere to the traffic management plan at all times . There is only access rights to drive up to the access point and enter through the gate, . We DO NOT have any access rights to park vehicles in the estate, in the parking bays, grass verges, pavements or on any roads within the estate. We DO NOT have any access rights to unload on the access Rd. Vehicles must not exceed speeds of 20mph. Please note that this access has history of lineside neighbour noise complaints. Please manage accordingly.

New walkway installed with a pedestrian barrier on the Harbour Road Sidings for the temporary fuel facility. Trains will be serviced from both sides therefore a personnel barrier has been installed on the Rose Street curve side of the Harbour road to prevent operatives from walking onto the operational line. The new pedestrian barrier/walkway starts at approximately 115m from the existing level crossing and continues for approximately 66m. The temporary fuel facility will be brought into use from 0700hrs Tuesday 20th June 2017.

Pantograph Monitoring System cameras have been installed at Braidwood on the footbridge and will be working from 18th January 2020. The camera is located on the footbridge and contains lasers to be able to scan the pantograph. The cameras contains 2 types of lasers: ~LDS30 Laser Ranges~- The laser ranges are used for distance measurements and for identifying when a train/pantograph is under the scanner. ~- The laser ranges are Laser Class 1 and therefore considered eye safe under all conditions. ~ZQ1 Line Laser ~- The line laser emits a laser line with an angel of 60 degrees.~- The line laser is not to be considered eye safe at the emitting point of the laser. However since the laser spreads its energy in an angle, the intensity per area decreases with the distance. ~~It has been agreed that when work is taking place using machines underneath the cameras the cameras should be turned off. This can be done using the isolation switch on structure number G6 10 15.

However since the laser spreads its energy in an angle, the intensity per area decreases with the distance. ~ ~ It has been agreed that when work is taking place using machines underneath the cameras the cameras should be turned off. This can be done using the isolation switch on structure number EG 07 13.

The cameras contains 2 types of lasers: ~LDS30 Laser Ranges~- The laser ranges are used for distance measurements and for identifying when a train/pantograph is under the scanner. ~- The laser ranges are Laser Class 1 and therefore considered eye safe under all conditions. ~ZQ1 Line Laser ~- The line laser emits a laser line with an angel of 60 degrees.~- The line laser is not to be considered eye safe at the emitting point of the laser. However since the laser spreads its energy in an angle, the intensity per area decreases with the distance. ~~It has been agreed that when work is taking place using machines underneath the cameras the cameras should be turned off. Thornton Yard, Strathore Road is a Strategic Freight site that is leased to D B Cargo on a 125 year lease expiring in 2119. Network Rail do not have permission to store materials or have any compound areas in the lease area unless pre-arranged via the Property Services Scotland Team. It should be noted that any occupation will be under a Licence Agreement with D B Cargo and that any charges will be at a commercial level.

Before setting up a safe system of work within the confines of Corkerhill CSMD the PICOS shall meet with the Yard Coordinator. Full discussion and agreement shall be reached following Abellio ScotRail"s process MAIF007CK - Record of line Possession or blockage. Form MAI/F/007/CK shall be completed with the Yard Coordinator and PICOS . Staff cannot go on or near the line in Corkerhill CSMD area until full agreement has been reached with the Yard Coordinator and PICOS and all safety protocols have been put in place for staff to remain safe from the passage of trains. Please contact Glasgow WHSEA for more assistance.

Chromium contamination throughout this area. This area is known for being affected by chromium contamination arising from waste from the former Shawfield Chemical Works which was located close to this area. Site workers must be briefed on the presence of, and risks posed by, Chromium as part of the site induction before entering the area. Specific occupational risk management including specific PPE and Health Surveillance must be considered and in place before any tasks are undertaken in this are. Please contact your local Health and Safety Advisor and Environment Manager for further information and specific Work Activity Risk Assessment content.

Access to the station roof is via the lift or stairs on platforms 9 and 10. Contractors working on the roof should be careful not to disturb existing glazing and should notify the SSM of any damaged glass discovered, ensuring compliance with Safe System of Work. Contractors should also be mindful of objects which may be thrown from the windows of the adjoining hotel.

THE SUITABILITY OF THE EDGE PROTECTION ON THIS STRUCTURE CANNOT BE RELIED UPON TO PREVENT A FALL FROM HEIGHT. UNASSISTED WARNING SSOW WORKING IS PROHIBITED, ATWS/LOWS MAY BE USED ONLY IF THE STRUCTURE IS LESS THAN 30 METRES LONG AND A MINIMUM 25 SECOND WARNING TIME IS BEING USED. ONLY ACTIVITIES THAT CAN BE CARRIED OUT WHILST REMAINING WITHIN THE 4 FOOT ARE ALLOWED TO BE UNDERTAKEN ON THIS STRUCTURE, UNLESS SUITABLE CONTROL MEASURES TO PREVENT FALLS FROM HEIGHT ARE APPROVED AND RECORDED BY AN ENGINEER AND IMPLEMENTED ON SITE.

S&T cables parallel to and under track. Various cables present. Drain parallel to and under track. Overhead power cables. See reference SH000863 and drawing TRC 00-06.

Platform 10/11 - hoist no 63. This must only be used by authorised personnel. Access to the hoist mechanism is via a staircase. The archway leads to the fire exit to the low level station. There are manhole covers on the floor and switchboard and cables/pipe work on the walls. Since the manhole covers could not be removed, they should be considered as limited access / confined space unless discovered otherwise. The hazards within the sub basement include electrical, biological, falls and asbestos .

Within the voids beneath the platforms there is the likelihood of the presence of vermin. This is particularly the case in those arches which are currently unused and contain large amounts of rubbish, thus providing a potential breeding ground. Adjacent to ‘The Arches’ is a lane with a number of arches used for storage purposes. This area is known to be frequented by vagrants, prostitutes and drug addicts. Care is to be taken to avoid contact with hypodermic syringes. Contractors should be aware that poison has been put down at various locations.

Arch E5 - HV switch room. This area is the high voltage compound and access is restricted to authorised persons with a Level C card. It is believed that asbestos is present in the cladding of walls above head height, please see ARMS for details.
Signal box temporarily removed. Structure is Grade "A" listed and is now in storage within a secure compound adjacent to the station building for re-election at a future date.

High Potential for tripping hazard due to surface water on concrete slab track sections of the Arglye line between Rutherglen and Finnieston.This may conceal the presence of holes in the slab track throughout in the 4 foot, 6 foot and or cess. These holes can be up to 7 inch deep or more. Particular attention should be considered during any safety brefings before going on or near the line and staff made aware of this hazard.This includes the following tunnels;Dalmarnock Tunnel; Canning Street Tunnel; Anderston Tunnel East Portal; Anderston Tunnel West Portal; Stobcross Street Tunnel and Kelvinhaugh Tunnel.

This water and wall calcification in the tunnel area have been taken for micro-biological analysis. Two reports concluded "Due to the negative results for the Coliform and E. coli bacteria and general low bacteria levels detected in the water ingress, there is a low risk from bacteriological hazards to staff working in the tunnel. Based on the results obtained from this assessment, staff working within the system should wear appropriate PPE including disposable gloves and coveralls to minimise any direct contact. It is presumed that standard eye protection and hard hats will be worn as a minimum requirement for any task which should be suitable in respect for reducing contact with the water ingress." More details on the reports can be found by contacting Glasgow Delivery Unit WHSEA.

The 11KV - HV cable follows a route from the HV compound ET3 in a southerly direction for 35yds at approx 2.35m BGL below tracks towards a turning chamber on the south side of the depot road adjacent the crane. It then follows a ducted route in the verge at approx. 750mm BGL for 80yds to an access chamber and crosses under the road to another chamber in the wideway to the south of Headshunt 21. The route then follows the line of the fence until it reaches a further chamber and from this point the cable passes below the concrete of the vehicle turning circle and heads towards the Carriage wash plant room a total distance of approx 300yds

Chromium contamination throughout this area. This area is known for being affected by chromium contamination arising from waste from the former Shawfield Chemical Works which was located close to this area. Site workers must be briefed on the presence of, and risks posed by, Chromium as part of the site induction before entering the area. Specific occupational risk management including specific PPE and Health Surveillance must be considered and in place before any tasks are undertaken in this are. Please contact your local Health and Safety Advisor and Environment Manager for further information and specific Work Activity Risk Assessment content.

Arches below New Street Car Park - The Vaults. The vaults lie directly below much of the car park and is a series of arches that is entered from a metal gate in New Street. Rooms off the first arch have wood strewn around, there are loading bays exposing risks of falls, various items of discarded materials. There are some manholes within the main central passage, which could not be removed and therefore be considered as confined spaces/limited access. Much of the electrical equipment has been water damaged and out of use, but some is live since the lighting tends to be on constantly.
Note: This Access Point also gives access to ELR: SUB2 between 000.0242 and 000.0990

Networkrail owned equipment room at Rutherglen containing GEC GCB relay insterlocking equipment. Networkrail owned equipment room at Polmadie containing GEC GCB relay insterlocking equipment. The equipment room floors are covered by grey vinyl tiles and adhesive which after testing was noted to contain very low levels of asbestos. Low levels of asbestos were also found on the cable wrap to electrical incoming cable via the DNO supply. There is no restriction on entering the equipment room however care must be taken not to disturb the floor tilesor cable wrap to electrical. Please refer to ARMS report for Polmadie Relay Room information.

The RRAP that has been installed in the area backs onto Southbrae Drive a residential area. This area and residents are extremely sensitive to noise and vibration in the area and have raised complaints against railway workers in the area. As with all areas all railway workers shall take care and ensure that noise is kept to the minimum and manage the enviroment and and social impact of noise and vibration. This shall be briefed to all staff and reviewed during the planning and verification of ongoing works.

Records of the water supply pipeline layouts although limited are indicative of main runs and are held by the Senior Asset Manager and the Facility Delivery Manager. Contractors should note that drainage exists beneath platforms.

Records of gas supply pipelines are held by the Senior Asset Manager and the Facility Delivery Manager. All mains gas supply pipes up to and including the meter are the responsibility of National Grid. In case of emergency contact 0800 111 999. Natural gas is non-toxic, but large concentrations could cause suffocation. It is highly flammable and leakage from a pipeline could result in an explosive mixture with air. Noise of escaping gas could be sufficient to cause damage to hearing and ear protection must be worn. All persons must be kept 100 metres from the damaged pipeline.

The existing train shed is in a poor state of repair with corrosion to many of the steel and cast members which in turn support timber trusses in various stages of deterioration and rot, so caution should be taken when working on the roof. The roof is coming up for a complete refurbishment in 2010 - 2014. Further safety information about working on the roof can be found in Edinburgh Waverley Station's "Station Safety Briefing" C-06 and C-38. Three areas of the roof have been refurbished and covered with ETFE fabric membrane, which has all been delineation with warning signs between the covered and non-covered parts of the roof. To allow the new covered roof area to be maintained and to be inspected regularly, a safe form of access and maintenance strategy has been devised.

Signalling Centre - Scottish Power HV Substation B. This sub station is owned and controlled by Scottish Power. Only authorised persons are permitted entry. Please note this is not Sub Station ‘B’ as this is located at the signalling centre and does not form part of this directory.

SCOTTISH POWER HIGH VOLTAGE SUB STATION AND METERS ARE LOCATED TRACKSIDE OF PLATFORM 9. ACCESS TO THE SUB STATION IS OBTAINED FROM THE OVER BRIDGE AND A PURPOSE BUILT LADDER AND WALKWAY. THE KEYS FROM THE OVER BRIDGE ARE HELD BY THE STATION MANAGEMENT. THE WALKWAY FORMS A PROTECTION SSOW FROM THE INFRASTRUCTURE AND POSSESSIONS ARE NOT REQUIRED.

South Block Building - Plant room. The access to the Plant Room has various floor levels, raised threshold at entrance door and other raised levels. There are numerous pipes and cables with low headroom in areas. Hazards associated with this area are confined space / limited access, trips, head bumps and electrical.

This room contains machinery for the Balmoral Hotel goods lift. The entrance is 1½’ x 3’ approx. and inside there is no floor but the cables and workings for the lift. This should be considered limited access. Hazards associated with this area are electrical, mechanical and falls; also those contained in limited access situations.

Basement Room 6, off Bridge Pier Corridor - Calorifer. This room contains numerous lagged pipework and electrical controls associated with the equipment. It is believed that the tanks are lagged with asbestos material and it has been registered.

Buried Power cable 240/415v originates from internal supply at Cathcart ECR NGRS 258738-660846 at the 0m 0440 yards. Cable first enters trough route for 30m, then via a URX for 13m, then via trough route for 160m, then enters GRP route for 6m climbs banking to meet trough route at the main lines, the cable enters this route and proceeds within for the next 100m, the cable then crosses the both lines via UTX for 12m, then back into trough route for 67m towards REB, finally on approach to REB it goes via buried trough for 5m and then via surface trough route for 7m to rear of REB. Total length of 400m. REB located at 258610 - 660925 at the 1M 1699 Yards point.

BURIED ELECTRICAL CABLE CABLE RUNS FROM PES CAB LOCATED AT EASTING 223750 & NORTHING 642261 IN BOUNDARY FENCE AT THE 30M 0584YARDS POINT.CABLE FIRST RUNS IN BURIED DUCT FOR 6M THEN IN TROUGH ROUTE FOR 150M AWAY FROM PES LOCATION THEN ACROSS BOTH RUNNING LINES VIA UTX FOR 12M THEN BACK TOWARDS PES LOCATION VIA TROUGH ROUTE FOR 60M THEN ACROSS SINGLE LINE VIA UTX FOR 10M THEN FINALLY AWAY FROM PES LOCATION IN TROUGH ROUTE FOR 50M TO REAR OF REB LOCATED AT EASTING 223616 & NORTHING 642336 AT THE 30M 1112YARDS POINT.

BURIED ELECTRICAL CABLE CABLE RUNS FROM PES CAB LOCATED AT EASTING 235657 & NORTHING 657855 AT THE 15M 1287 YARDS POINT AND RUNS FOR 14M FROM PES CAB IN TROUGH ROUTE THEN ACROSS UTX THEN VIA BACK INTO TROUGH ROUTE FOR 33M TO REAR OF REB LOCATED AT EASTING 236003 & NORTHING 657844. AT THE 15M 1320YARDS POINT.

BURIED ELECTRICAL CABLE CABLE RUNS FROM PES CAB LOCATED IN BOUNDARY FENCE IN ALBERT ROAD AT EASTING 258752 & NORTHING 662288 AT THE 0M 1739 YARDS POINT AND RUNS FIRST FOR 10M IN BURIED DUCTING THEN INTO TROUGH ROUTE FOLLOWING A U SHAPE FOR 20M TO REAR OF REB LOCATED AT EASTING 258757 & NORTHING 662291 AT THE 0M 1320YARDS POINT.
Lateral resistence ends plates have been installed in the 4ft of the Down Road through-out the mileage above.

SUSPECTED ASBESTOS - Telecoms Troughing Route. Eleveated troughing route x2 between Bridge Street and Eglinton Street Tunnel. Lower section of troughing route appears to be empty and has collapsed at various stages along the route. Sections of the collapsed route have been placed within the recess areas in the tunnel.

Limit of 3 tonnes gross vehicle and plant weight limit applicable to all concourse and platform areas. Requests for dispensation up to a higher limit must be accompanied by a structural assessment and submitted to the Senior Asset Manager for consideration.

Requirement to disturb the surface within the station's controlled area, the Buried Services Procedure shall be followed at all times. Work will not be allowed to commence until such time that a Permit to Dig/Penetrate form has been duly signed by the Contract Administrator. It is suspected that low voltage cables are located underground throughout the station. Each contractor will be responsible for the scanning of the work site in order to locate the exact location of the underground power cable

Two new REB"s installed between Line 4 and Number 3 Siding. New pedestrian stairway access and new materials hoist to these two REB"s created within Arch 67 located on Commerce Street. Personnel can use stairway to gain access to the two REB"s during normal rail traffic periods. During normal rail traffic periods, personnel must remain within the area surrounded by the handrails which have been installed alongside each REB and they must not stray from the newly created walkway in between the two. Doors have been fitted to both ends of the REB"s to aid emergency escape. Key to Arch 67 obtained from local maintenance S&T.

THE SUITABILITY OF THE EDGE PROTECTION ON THIS STRUCTURE CANNOT BE RELIED UPON TO PREVENT A FALL FROM HEIGHT. UNASSISTED WARNING SSOW WORKING IS PROHIBITED, ATWS/LOWS MAY BE USED ONLY IF THE STRUCTURE IS LESS THAN 30 METRES LONG AND A MINIMUM 25 SECOND WARNING TIME IS BEING USED. ONLY ACTIVITIES THAT CAN BE CARRIED OUT WHILST REMAINING WITHIN THE 4 FOOT ARE ALLOWED TO BE UNDERTAKEN ON THIS STRUCTURE, UNLESS SUITABLE CONTROL MEASURES TO PREVENT FALLS FROM HEIGHT ARE APPROVED AND RECORDED BY AN ENGINEER AND IMPLEMENTED ON SITE.
